snippet: Tokyo was selected to host the 2020 Summer Games, beating out Istanbul and Madrid in a major victory for a country still recovering from a nuclear plant meltdown.
abstract: Tokyo is selected to host 2020 Summer Olympics in what is considered a safe rather than transformative choice in a time of political and economic uncertainty around the globe; beats out Istanbul and Madrid in a major victory for a country still recovering from a nuclear plant meltdown.

byline.original: By JERÉ LONGMAN and MARTIN FACKLER
byline.contributor: Jeré Longman reported from Buenos Aires and Martin Fackler from Tokyo. Reporting was contributed by Hiroko Tabuchi and Joshua Hunt from Tokyo, Raphael Minder from Madrid and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Tokyo was selected to host the 2020 Summer Games, beating out Istanbul and Madrid in a major victory for a country still recovering from a nuclear plant meltdown.

headline.main: For 2020 Olympics, I.O.C. Picks Tokyo, Considered Safe Choice
